name: BitStreamVR
description:
This is a casual virtual reality game; either meant to be played by one's self or with a group of people; with each person taking a turn. The object of the game is to collect as many "bits" as possible to achieve a high score! As each round progresses the stream of bits becomes more and more intense! With bits spawning faster and faster and in longer chains. If the player misses a bit they have a few moments to collect as many bits as they can before the player loses a life. If the player loses all of their lives, the game round is over and the player is rewarded their score! If you download the game in the .zip there is a read-me to give you any information you might need. The game does require a 64bit Windows OS. The game does use Oculus touch or HTC Vive controllers as input; if you do not have either the game will not work. It is recommended that you have a 2 meter by 2 meter space.

** Download **
Feel free to download the game for free! I left the default pay what you want on it; in case anyone wanted to fund this small game as I work on it. That being said, please do not feel obligated to pay for it! If you want to download the demo for free please do so! However please let me know what you think! Good or bad; any feedback makes it better.

** Note **
The Project used to be called beryl when it was a 2-d phone game; which is what the .exe is called.

** Other Information **
The link is to download the demo version.
The Demo version only has a two difficulties; the medium and the hard difficulties. Both of which are taken out of the full game from the video. The difficulties both scale as time goes on so there is no real ending. Just disabled the easy and impossible difficulties for this demo.

** Hardware Needed: **
Oculus Touch Controllers
or
HTC Vive Controllers

** OS Information **
Windows 7, 8, or 10
64 Bit
